text:
Apache2 cannot seemingly send raw files to clients from a smbfs mount. 
Attempts to do so result in a zero length file being sent to the client.

Apache2 itself it can read files well from smbfs, and send interpretted files 
from these mounts to clients (ie php script mounted on smbfs works fine).

The smbfs mount works fine at a filesystem level and via other mechanisms 
(scp,cp,mv,etc)
creator: michaelcarew@bytecraftsystems.com

text:
This is a known issue. See:
http://httpd.apache.org/docs-2.0/mod/core.html#enablesendfile

It is not a problem with Apache, but rather an issue with FreeBSD's (and most
operating systems!) implmentation of networked filesystems.

Please add "EnableSendfile off" to your configuration.

If this does not fix your problem, please reopen this bug.

Thank you for using Apache!
creator: chip@force-elite.com
